smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class TextFragment is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class MainActivity is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function setupFragment appears to be too complex.
The function getViewAt appears to be too complex.
The function newTitleConfirmed appears to be too complex.
The function saveFolder appears to be too complex.
The function onOptionsItemSelected appears to be too complex.
The function exportAllNotes appears to be too complex.
The function exportNoteValueToFile appears to be too complex.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'TextFragment' with '21' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'NotesPagerAdapter' with '17' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'ChecklistAdapter' with '16' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'MainActivity' with '56' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'SettingsActivity' with '21' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'WidgetConfigureActivity' with '13' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.name: ObjectPropertyNaming
smells.description: Property names inside objects should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Private object property names should match the pattern: (_)?[A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9]*

smells.name: FunctionNaming
smells.description: Function names should follow the naming convention set in the configuration.

instances.message: Function names should match the pattern: ^([a-z$][a-zA-Z$0-9]*)|(`.*`)$
Function names should match the pattern: ^([a-z$][a-zA-Z$0-9]*)|(`.*`)$

smells.name: VariableNaming
smells.description: Variable names should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

smells.name: FunctionParameterNaming
smells.description: Function parameter names should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Function parameter names should match the pattern: [a-z][A-Za-z0-9]*

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (Index(value = ["id"], unique = true)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Index(value = ["id"], unique = true)

smells.name: DataClassContainsFunctions
smells.description: Data classes should mainly be used to store data and should not have any extra functions. (Compiler will automatically generate equals, toString and hashCode functions)

instances.message: The data class Note contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called getNoteStoredValue

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.
